article:
In Biology, a 'substrate' is the surface on which a plant or animal lives. A
substrate can include biotic or abiotic materials and animals. For example,
encrusting algae that lives on a rock (its substrate) can be itself a substrate
for another animal that lives on top of the algae.

See also a similar sense with substrate (marine biology) and a different sense
with enzyme substrate in biochemistry and molecular biology.
